body:
Forgive the "duplicate" question. I'd like to see this solved in Emacs Lisp too, and if I just tagged it for both topics, I probably would have only gotten one answer. The Emacs answer should be sufficiently different that it's probably worthwhile to have it. I want to teach myself Spanish and I've got several word lists like the data show below. How can I generate a quiz from the data that looks like this? 
amarillo?  [ ] blue    [ ] yellow  [ ] gray   [ ] pink
azul?      [ ] red     [ ] blue    [ ] green  [ ] orange
 .
 .
 .
verde?     [  ] purple [ ] gold   [ ] green   [ ] black
The idea is to randomly include the answer with 3 randomly chosen incorrect answers. Ideally, the incorrect answers would not be too repetitive. 
amarillo|yellow
azul|blue
blanco|white
dorado|golden
gris|gray
marrón|brown
naranja|orange
negro|black
oro|gold
púrpura|purple
rojo|red
rosa|pink
verde|green
title: Generating a quiz in Emacs Lisp?
